author: Ken Stanton
title: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools
description: Many in nations like Malawi already have smartphones. Laptops can cost 2-3 months' wages. Cardano development could be more mobile friendly.

assessments.note: This is an interesting proposal but 1. IOHK is already working on Marlowe mobile tooling and 2. it feels like the demand for this from Cardano devs would be small.

The proposer presents an interesting problem i.e., "how to make it easier for developers to use mobile devices for development in countries where laptops or desktops might be cost prohibitive"), and presents a solution. However, how that solution is to be implemented is not very clear. Recommend to include some diagrams and limit the information in the proposal to relevant information to increase the effectiveness of the proposal.
Interesting idea which could broaden the base of available developers
The idea is great and the problem formulation about the availability of laptops/smartphones is definitely valid. This could effectively onboard a large number of new developers.
The timeline and deliverables section of the proposal are detailed.

The proposer provides some experience, but it does not seem very relevant for the problem domain. For example, specifying experience with Web UI development, ReactJS, or perhaps iOS or Android app development might be more relevant. The budget outlined mentions training a team but it is unclear how members of the team will contribute to the project. The proposer's links to github show some related work in their repos.
Whilst the proposer has many years programming experience, it seems this is an idea and 52 weeks should be enough to do it. Thus it is hard to say if it will be successful.
The proposal does not contain much information to evaluate this, the linked github repository is not very active, and there are not much information on the rest of the team.

The proposer includes a lot of extraneous information, such as travel itineraries and personal information like what they are packing for their trip that is not very relevant to the proposal. They briefly mention Blockly, a visual programming editor but it is not very clear as to how it fits in. I'd recommend focusing more on this aspect, i.e. "using Blockly to implement a Plutus Contract in a web interface on a mobile device" as a more tangible goal. The proposer doesn't mention if there are any risks relating to current toolchains such as compiling a contract on a mobile device. Would the solution require some kind of back-end server solution?
It addresses the challenge by creating a new dev tool kit. Feasibility is a harder question as it is not clear the proposer is certain it is tractable.
The proposal is fairly complete, gret that the funding requests are explained, and that there are a clear timeplan with deliverables. The only thing missing is some more information on the team.

solution: A touch-optimized web-based interface to allow people to construct and learn about Plutus and Marlowe code visually w/ enforced type safety.
